intro: Decaisnina, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in a variety of colors. The plants typically have a basal rosette of leaves and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Decaisnina species are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions. They are also valued for their ecological role in supporting pollinators.
